meanings.definition: To change the key or combination of a lock.
meanings.sent1: I need to rekey the front door lock because I lost my keys.
meanings.sent2: The locksmith will rekey the office door to enhance security.
meanings.sent3: It's time to rekey the lock and give it a fresh start.
meanings.sent4: She decided to rekey her life, just like changing a lock's key.
meanings.sent5: Remember to rekey the lock to keep your belongings safe.

meanings.definition: To enter a new key or combination into a lock.
meanings.sent1: Please rekey the safe with the new code for added protection.
meanings.sent2: The security guard will rekey the gate to allow access to authorized personnel.
meanings.sent3: He had to rekey the lock quickly before the rain started.
meanings.sent4: She had to rekey her memory with the new information like a lock with a new key.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to rekey the lock with the spare key.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the key or combination of a lock.
meanings.sent1: The rekey of the front door lock was necessary after the break-in.
meanings.sent2: A professional locksmith can perform a rekey for added security.
meanings.sent3: The rekey of the lock brought peace of mind to the homeowner.
meanings.sent4: The rekey of the lock symbolized a fresh start for the family.
meanings.sent5: The rekey of the lock was a simple solution to the security issue.
